comment:
My new favorite rye   Worth every penny 
Just bought a second bottle

Nose: wet earth and acetone sweetness.

Taste: creamy, some spice but not too much. Smooth and doesn’t bite back.  Thankfully I don’t get the pickle flavors but rather dark chocolate and slight hint of mint. What keeps messing with my head is the nail polish remover fumes up my sinus.

Second time reviewing this one

Nose - floral and spices. It’s complex but cannot quite grasp everything going on.

Taste - full and rich immediately. As it rolls on the tongue I get some floral notes and spices. The finish is nice and long with light to medium heat with baking spices and more floral notes. Quite smooth for the proof.

Overall and value - this is an excellent rye. Very drinkable and smooth considering the proof and only 4 years. Quite good but comes with a 50-60+ price tag and sometimes more. Very good nonetheless and a must have for anyone wanting a great rye.

Huge fruit bowl. Not like the mild honey kind, but the in your face every fruit available kind. Apples, pears, clementines, fresh cherries, bananas, big vanilla, clove, and rye spice. This one is very smooth and creamy.
carmel corn, leather, and a little oak with an expansive spicy finish, hot and lingering heat. opens some with ice.

Sweet and perfume-y with bold cherry, vanilla, clove and a touch of anise on the nose, only a faint hint of oak. Slightly oily mouth feel, not velvety, but not sharp either. Smooth finish. Cherries, rye spice,  and a dash of pepper. Extraordinary.
Hot aroma, oily mouthfeel, a little spicy but there’s a fruity sweetness and it’s surprisingly smooth.

Nose - fruity and floral

Taste - sweet rye with a hint of pickle juice, slight spice

Aftertaste - smooth finish with a small bite going down
Rich and floral. Sweet fruit flavors, leaves a nice oily feeling on your tongue. So delicious.
score!  if ya find this, buy this.  it's a terrific, well balanced Rye.  some spice to go with Rich and balanced mouthfeel

Tried with a great friend. His first time trying it as well. I was very excited when I found this bottle.
Very sweet and well rounded. Normally while nosing something this high ABV I have to give it some distance but this doesn’t smell or taste like a Cask strength whiskey. It’s complex and wonderful with a little spicy edge but not harsh or painful. Fruit and Vanilla before the spice. This was by far my best experience with Rye and I’m looking forward to the rest of the bottle.
Sharp notes of pencil shavings and corn

Wowza this is good. The nose is a bit briny, but sweet. Caramel and vanilla comes through. It has spice on the front with a bit of cinnamon and chocolate. Velvety, fruity and sweet. Absolutely delicious.
Awesome rye. It’s sweet, but I get a hint of pickle. Glad I have two bottles.

114.4 proof 2018 release.

A beautiful deep orange color.  The legs hide at first, but once they form they slowly grow thick and oily down the sides of the glass.  An attractive whiskey.

An uncharacteristically rich, creamy, tropical fruit nose.  Cherry vanilla cream soda with some un-identifiable exotic spices.

A full-fledged fruity assault on the palate.  So rich and flavorful.  Carries some characteristic pepper and mint rye notes, but those are just the sidebar to the intense flavors.  Wow.  Rosewater.  White grape.  Valencia orange rind.  Cocoa.  Sweet, sweet toasted marshmallow.  Juicy Fruit gum overlaid with white peppercorn.  Some semblance to a bold brandy or grappa, but so much more spice and character.  A creamy, oily mouthfeel.  Dazzling pepper on the tongue for a finish with a little tingle in the cheeks and back of the throat.  Lasting.

Final thoughts = whoa.  Buckle up your seatbelts.  I think I love it but I need to revisit just to catch my breath.  Truly extraordinary - I’ve never had another rye anything like this...
Picking up lots of mint this time around.
Great Rye!  It's a great cigar Rye.  Bold spice, but a smooth mouth feel to finish.  Very clean...

106.2 proof. Second tasting as good as the first. Big rye spice on the nose. Big rye spice upfront on the palate. Turns into a hot (as expected with a rye), vanilla finish that is very enjoyable. Just as delicious as the first taste. Will definitely enjoy this bottle.

color - caramel
smell - orange
taste - citrus, bright, spicy, juicy granny smith apple finish
+6 drops water added a brightness and brought out the spiciness

thanks for sharing Cole!

The first thing to say about this bottle: I am in love. While I have been turning more and more to rye whiskey lately as my obsession of choice, the Willett 4-Year Barrel Proof Rye is the missing link between a proper bourbon and a perfect rye. Of course, every palate has its own preferences.

Immediately apparent in this rye, both in the nose and taste, is the artful balance of sweet and spice, honey and heat... it’s a tug of war on the tongue that swings to sweet, but pulls back to bite in the finish.

Nose: The sweetness hits early with dark fruit and vanilla, then quickly turns to spice, clove and cinnamon at the forefront. All these aromatics blend ever more beautifully the longer you let it sit. And while you wait, just gaze into that glowing golden goodness just beckoning you to give in and drink it already.

Taste: What the nose hints, the taste hits. There’s that wave of cinnamon and clove, enveloped in vanilla, and filled out with faint traces of wood grain, not nutty or toasted, but more earthy, almost like a fresh mint. What lingers on the finish is that same spice that welcomed you in your initial waft.

Overall, I would say I have just found my new favorite dram. Wish I had bought two.
106.2 proof. Great rye spice and satisfying finish

Tried this immediately after the 3 year.  Really enjoy this family of Rye’s; the 4 is softer on first taste but the heat comes soon enough.  Both great bottles but in a toss up 3/4 in my group preffed the 3 year.  I found the 3 year to be much harsher so I enjoyed the 4.

Wow this just agrees with my palate, exactly the flavors I want, freaking delicious juice.
Minty, cedar, woodsy, tobacco.  A little heat cinnamon, but again the wood comes in and I love it, not overpowering but perfectly placed.  The finish is short for me. I wish the finish was more complex and longer, as a result, I find myself quickly re-lifting the glass to revisit and endulge in that amazing taste over and over again.  This is so delicious to drink. I'm glad I found it, and for $50.  I only see it in stock at the higher end stores. I'll probably run out and buy another!
Cinnamon, chocolate, port wines, rye spices, gum drops. Quite complex and unique.
One of the most interesting noses I’ve ever experienced. Lot of mint in the nose that carries over to the palette. The rye spice is strong, but not overpowering.

Note: this is only the 3 year review. 

initially not a fan of this bottle but once it sat open for a little while it really developed into a strong pour. 

Nose: rye spices, cinnamon, nutmeg, anise, maybe some cardamom?
Palate: Cinnamon really comes through. this is like apple pie spices and cinnamon nonstop. as that degrades, you get some mint, herbal essences, a touch of ethanol. 
Finish: mint comes through once again and a touch of the spiciness of the rye makes an appearance; but it’s not overbearing. i believe this is a low rye-content rye; perhaps 51% or 65% rye, doubtful it’s more than that.
Great flavor. Big taste. Still smooth. Wonderful finish.
Floral, fruit and citrus bomb, spicy and warming. This rye is worth every penny and is outstanding for only 4yrs in a barrel.
113.8 proof. Floral, sweet, with fruit and spice at the end. Slight bitterness. So much better than the 3-year version. 2/15/19
So delicious!! Floral, spice, and vanilla on the nose. Rye spice, apples on the palate. And a nice long spicy finish.

Damn good stuff rite her! Literally makes my nose burn with a deep sniff. With a shallow sniff I get lots of oak, vanilla, banana and stone fruits.

The flavor profile starts off nice and sweet, some caramel, toffee, grains and a little banana. It morphs into this intense rye driven beast that tingles your tongue as you roll it. It finishes with.... and I had to think hard but it hit me like a barrel... pickle brine!

Nice and viscous, it sticks around.
Strong on the nose and on the palate. There’s just enough burn to compliment the excellent flavor.  If you like big rye flavor with lots of sweetness and nuance, you’ll love this whiskey.
Vanilla almond nose. Sip...Clean, light  floral notes, refreshing, ending with a bang of heat that dissipates oh so nicely. In a year this will be double the price.

The nose is a floral bouquet which belies the flavors to follow. Don't know if I've ever had a rye before that is so true to the grain. It's like a bite of hot rye bread with black pepper. Nice heat level, flavor eventually fades into mild salty dill. Not overly complex but very unique. This whiskey is like no other I've had.
Easily one of my favorite rye’s. Tried it in a flight with woodford rye, knob creek rye, and one other. Willet was my favorite by far.
Just started getting into ryes. A drop of water smoothed this out and extended the finish. stilling trying to find the vocabulary to describe the heat and spice in this.

Rich, spicy, oily
Best Rye I’ve had outside of Boss Hog III. Solid 👍🏼
Best Rye I’ve had. Effing amazing!
You can taste the young but omg this is fantastic. Fruity floral light kick on the back the sticks just a tad. Good nose. It’s like a cherry hinted chocolate crunch bar. Sooo damn good.
So delicious I’ve had this and others so many times the deep dark fruit flavors soo goooodddd
Simply the best balanced rye that I have had!

Bourbon sweetness merged with rye spices
Whiskey Club- Henry St Taproom
Hated this when I first got it. Had to settle in to the proof. Is now easily my favorite. Haven't tried it in a while, so no actual tasting notes.
Excellent rye!  Unique taste. Sweeter start. Citrusy. Probably everyone’s favorite for the night.
Subtle sweetness and gentle spice make for a great combination that is incredibly enjoyable, this is a top shelf rye and incredible for just being aged 4 years.
The best rye for the price when you can find it. Complex sweetness, right amount of spice, and all with a high proof. Best way to drink it is with your friends.

Wow. Simply wow! The beauty of rye is that it tends to age quicker so a 4 year old can be very developed. This one blows it out the water. The fullness and smoothness of this rye for being just shy of 110 proof can’t be beat. It’s fantastic!
Early spice spearmint in the end nice finish

A standout.

Reviewed this a year ago. Since then this has become one of my regular ryes. Getting a bit more expensive as the years go on, but any rye drinker should have at least a few bottles of this.
Spicy; full, thick on the palate; almonds and brown sugar. Loooong finish.
Excellent. Hefty ABV which then transitions into a full nasal cleaning experience. Excellent, but not the best.

Neat.  Lots of depth on this nose.  Lots of vanilla, floral flavors.  Peppermint.  Nice creamy mouth feel.  Wow.  Caught me by surprise.  Unique as hell.  Honey up front.  Creme brûlée?  Pepper and mint again.  This is amazing stuff.

Nose: Tart cherries, dill pickle juice, cinnamon
Palate: Milk chocolate, caramel, baking spices, pomegranate.  
Cherries jubilee finish
Thanks for giving me a reason to open this one @Zslug!

Tasting:  Neat in glen cairn and then with 3 drops of water.  Proofed at 109.4.

Nose: (4.0)  Chocolatey and rich.  Spicier with some ethanol, and cereal.  The nose tells you this dram is no fooling.  Whiff harder and there is some butterscotch notes in the background

Palate (4.5):  A bit spicy at first, a bit of water really opens up some great flavors.  Chocolate and cereal are dominant, but then I get some orange marmalade and ginger snap cookie with that.  The mouthfeel is very coating and oily.  This is an incredibly rich rye.

Finish (4.25):  The palate follows through to a nice long finish.  Some oak pops towards the end and really stays with you.  The spiciness turns sweeter and a bit of smoke pops  Really enjoyable.

Overall:  This is super good.  I can't believe this is only a four year old!  It is rich and tasty, finishes long and allows you to really taste the barrel.  I did not get the brine others spoke of, but I did get the spucy sweet notes.  I paid 54.00 for this bottle and got a secind right sway.

Let this one breathe for a few minutes to open the bouquet. Orange and pickle brine on first whiff. On second smell a bit of caramel comes into play. Let this sit on the tongue to bring out cherry, orange marmalade and pineapple. Cereal and grass round it out. Excellent.

The palate starts with brine with smooth rye mixed with chocolate, with oak and a touch of orange and pineapple holding it together. The palate is dry and initially fills the mouth with oak, with tropical fruit coming in a wave behind it, giving way to chocolate and rye, and brine, with caramel coming in at the end as it breathes. The finish is medium long with fading rye spiciness, tropical fruit, caramel and oak.
Sweetness of the rye, smooth finish. a hint of honey at the beginning of the palate and oakiness on the finish.
Prickly on the tongue. Little heat from the alcohol, some dill, rye spice, and oak. Just a touch of sweetness. Nice.

To me this rye reaches a level I’d call “spiritual.”  By far the best whiskey for the money I’ve ever tasted (55$ at the distillery).  I’m not drinking right now so I can’t do tasting notes, but if anyone has a chance to get this it’s excellent and extremely worth the price.

Okay, I’m either becoming a rye fan, or I’ve been on a streak of atypically good ryes. This one is right up there.

I can tell that I have some room to grow on what I can detect on ryes. Particularly the nose. This one holds brown sugar and fresh cut flowers.

Body is sweeter than I was expecting, and I taste lime juice and more sugar.

Finish has a very acidic mouth feel, currently not something I’m into on a day-to-day basis, but I get how people (and perhaps me one day) could be into it. There’s a bit of leather and dark chocolate in the finish.

Overall, this is not one iota overrated. It deserves its acclaim, and that’s coming from someone who still wouldn’t self-identify as a rye fan. I got brand new things in this rye that I’d never tasted before in a whiskey. Very happy to have these bottles on my shelf.
Palette: floral and citrus bomb. Cherry blossom, orange blossom, orange zest, spicy mint, soft oak, vanilla, fig. Incredible depth and smoothness for a 4yr
Chocolate. Cinnamon. Tart cherry. Slight mint.

A stunning bottle that tastes far superior than its 4-year age statement and $60 price.

A burst of spice upfront (like biting into a cinnamon crisp) quickly makes way to a long, sweet, biscotti finish. Surprisingly smooth and sweet for a rye that almost feels more like a bourbon

Revised: When I first opened this bottle, I was smacked in the face with ethanol, acetone, eucalyptus, mint, a whiff of honey and light malty notes. A very harsh medicinal nose. The palate was similarly harsh, reminding me of the old, original flavor of Listerine. Very heavily herbaceous, with notes of black pepper, and menthol. 

After a couple of months, the whiskey has opened up quite a bit, with the solvent notes fading a bit to be replaced by stronger notes of freshly cut grass, alfalfa, mint tea, eucalyptus, vanilla, and corn syrup. I don’t love this whiskey, but it is a nice example of a well crafted rye erring more towards the side of grassy, herbal flavors. 

This is a 102.2 proof version of this expression, purchased in Missoula MT.
Really smooth and tasty. Bought at distillery May 2019
Potato chip like nose, palates with some rye breads, and finishes with some chocolate cherries. Fantastic.

Uncut tasting(no water)
A hint of rye on the nose, spicy, wood.  Hot, fiery rye flavor, cinnamon, oak, fresh cherries - long, hot, dry finish with a gradually developing almond flavor - the cherry flavor lingers and wood, but more like cedar than oak.  I feel like this whiskey is wild and raw, but there is something elegant about it too.  It's like a thunderstorm in a glass.

Definitely dill on the nose. The mouth feel was oily in a good way. Flavors coming through were rye spice, vanilla, hints of dark fruit and a slight vegetal background. The finish was long and hot. Alcohol content played a factor here and many of my friends tasting preferred adding an ice cube. Overall this was a seriously good rye! I sat in not a rye guy but apparently in coming over to the dark side!
Extremely smooth. Vanilla and other sweet undertones
This might just be my favorite whiskey
A very polarizing rye for some reason but IMO the one best sub $100 bottles I have tried. Nice cinnamon forward complexity with the perfect amount of bite. A few drops of water opens it up a lot.

I will confess I am not the biggest Willett fan. I really didn't care for the Cinnamon Red Hot dominant 2 and 3 yr version of this bottle. I liked the 80 the anniversary for it SRP as a nice young expression. So I have been super hesitant to pay any money for this one (despite the overwhelming positive reviews). I got a pour a couple months back and didn't care for it. Today was the day I decided to try again and finally review it. For $8/pour I wasn't complaining. Let me set the scene, it's about 108 degrees and I am sitting on the patio of my favorite cigar bar since I don't want to deal with all the cigar smoke indoors (side note it was recently recognised in the Whiskey Advocate as one of the best Whiskey drinker's cigar bars in America). There are misters going and some shade but it is just hot. TV is showing the Open with Tiger and Rory struggling. So of course I decide to go for a cask strength dram! Haha. A tall pint of heavily iced water as a companion I dive in:
On the palette it's surprisingly easy to drink and does still have a dominant cinnamon notes but it's a bit more restrained. Caramel, honey and some butterscotch comes thru leading into a mid palette that features more cinnamon and some clove. The finish is medium length with toffee and more spice. 
Mouthfeel is a little thin for a cask strength dram. All in all this is the best Willett Rye I have had and it does seem to improve each year. 
Now would I go.out and buy a bottle for between $55-$65, in short no. For that price point there are many Ryes I'd drink over this. 
Cheers all and Happy Thirsty Thursday!

Odor: 
Lots of spices and herbs. Almost like musty vegetation/earth. A tiny bit of sharpness, not too sweet. 

Taste: 
Not much to it if swallowed quickly. Some spiciness at the end. Allowing it to linger at the front of the taste buds gives a minty spice, and the back, an overwhelming dill/earthy taste. 

Finish: Puckery and tart with some minty spice lingering.
A bit punchy, if you’re into that, with a flash of oomph across the tongue
I like it it’s unique. Going to take some getting used to.

I like this Rye very much and amazing how smooth it is for a 4yr Rye. 

This one is worth it if you can find it.
Started with some spice on the front end, but had a large vanilla flavor on the back end. Heat lasted for a considerable time after having a drink.

This Whiskey is one of my absolute favorites.  I get lots of citrus and butterscotch and it is AMAZINGLY smooth for a four year whiskey at high proof.  Happily for some reason - it has showed up in a few stores lately as it it can be difficult to find.

Unreal. beautiful, floral, pitted-fruit bomb with soft delivery that you’d hope to experience in the finest bourbon. Rye shows through as a superior grain in short time. This is a tremendously underrated bottle. Cheers!

Great cask strength rye at $50 and young age statement. My bottle is 126 proof. First un-corking revealed some spicy rye heat, acetone, but underlying bourbon-esque sweetness and sweetness. Halfway through the bottle, I’ve found I enjoy it with one large ice ball. Lightens up the spice, real briny on the nose, opens up citrus, cherry, floral blossoms, and faint spearmint aftertaste.
Complex, a lot of caramel then Citrus then spice. Extremely smooth for 110 proof!
Nose is spice and tobacco. It’s strong and spicy on the palate, but not burning at 110 proof
If you see it, buy it! Buy two bottles! Amazing juice.

Nose: The initial nosing brings out lots of green grass, rye spice, and a sort of licorice sweetness.  Lots of dill, cilantro, and maybe even fennel - this is full of herbs.  It almost reminds me of caraway, which makes me hesitant - I hate caraway...

Palate:  Cooling and not too sweet at first.  No alcohol burn and only a slight tingle mid-tongue.  Immediate burst of mint, licorice, and fennel before some grain forward notes that I'd almost call "malty" if this were a malt whiskey - interesting.  This reminds me of a Spruce-tip Shortbread Cookie I had the other day.

Finish:  Short-Medium and slightly dry.  The herbs die out pretty quickly, leaving walnut and char with some lingering oak.

Water dulls the overpowering herbs a bit, bringing out a buttery almond sort of scent.  There's also the unmistakable scent of DEET bugspray put on while out in the forest.  It feels much oilier and sweeter now with less licorice and caraway (thank god...) and more of a vegetal green note with some mint.  Buttery on the taste now and lasts longer, though that nice char and oak is gone from the finish.

Conclusion:  To be honest, this is one of the last bottles I'd grab on a normal night, I just can't do the dominating notes of licorice and caraway.  I couldn't have more than a very small pour of this every once in a while.  That being said, I think this is one of the most interesting and well-crafted whiskies I've ever had.  It is more complex than anything 4x it's age and changes with ever sip.  There's layer after layer of herb and spice that you could pick through for hours.  I have some serious respect for this one, it's just not the flavors I'd pick.  For that, I'm scoring it not on how much I like it, but instead on what it deserves as such a unique whiskey.
Spicy and rich with a fruity finish.
Sweet barrel. Beautifully smooth. No burn. Hits the dome nicely. I love this.
Apricot and fruity flavors. Light with rye taste
Vanilla, brown sugar on the nose. Pepper and spice on first taste. Medium finish
Love this!!! That finish is like biting into a tasty bread. Best rye!
Can't believe this is only 4 years old. Flavor explosion in your mouth and brain!

In my humble opinion this is not as good as I was hoping. It is interesting. This is the only bourbon I tasted dill notes in, which is why I say interesting. Not bad but not my flavor profile. I will spend the $65 is elsewhere.

Nose: bread-y, dough-y and full of honey, lemongrass, mint and a hint of caramel

Palate: spicy mint, more honey and light fruits, even a hint of sweet tea

Finish: medium. And the 100+ proof is barely evident. It’s very smooth and refined. There’s even a little vanilla and cinnamon hanging around. 

I’m a casual rye drinker. Generally ryes to me aren’t that complex and other than the spices it just doesn’t speak to my tastes. This, however, is amazing. It’s the best rye I’ve ever had for sure and one of the best whiskeys I’ve tasted. The high rating is well deserved. And at only four years it’s a steal because it tastes like and older whiskey—if you can find it at MSRP.
One of the best Ryes I’ve had. This nose begins with mint, cinnamon-sugar and some barrel char. The mouthfeel is silky smooth and the palette is chocolate, Rye and spice with a long finish.
In solidarity with @Zslug. Happy belated birthday!
Smooth and not as spicy as a typical Rye
Wow!  This is great. One of my favorite ryes. Buy and buy again. Sweet candy rye with nice spice and a finish that last forever. So good.
Compared with 3 yr, subtler and sweeter
Finally opened it and it was excellent. Drank like it was older than it is.
The very best Rye I’ve had to date. If you see it, then buy it. You won’t be dissatisfied in the least.
Absolutely phenomenal! Great flavor and depth. My favorite rye in my collection.
Probably the best Rye I’ve had to date. Chocolate and cherries on the nose with a citrus, leather, and a hint of dill. The finish is like biting into a heavenly slice of rye bread!!!🤯🤯🤯

Very good overall rye. Tasted neat in a Glencairn rested for 10min. On the nose are hints of rye and chocolate. The first sip makes me think of chocolate cereal with fruit. Think, chocolate raisin bran. The longer you hold it, the more cereal quality you get. Finish is long and spicy.
Vanilla, Cinnamon Toast Crunch, almond, nutmeg, and spice

Medium amber, medium body.  Nose is spicy at first, almost like cedar and maple.  There may be some slight oak and cherries.  Palate is pepper, leather and a subdued sweetness with a stinging rye in the mouth and ethanol on the throat.  There is mild lingering sweet cherry and slight floral finish.  It is not overly complex but provides something akin to a numbing effect from the spice and ethanol which are very well balanced.

Wow, this is definitely a Willett.

The nose has that hallmark Willett spice to it. It has cinnamon, freshly baked bread and of course rye spice. 

The palate has an explosion of flavor. Mainly rye, but I also get cola, and some anise.

The finish is long and very nice.

This is definitely the loudest and most unique ryes I’ve had. Very good.
Very fresh on the nose. Spicy grain fresh. Very spicy on the palate. The rye is sharp and heavy. Flavor is very full though. I like it, don’t love it.

My favorite rye of the last two years. 

Nose: Quite floral and dessert like flavor notes, including chocolate, mint, hence of caramel, grass, and even a light fruit

Palate: rich and decadent, more mint and some tobacco, cinnamon and rye spices mid palate but very balanced 

Finish: medium to long but with very little bite. Oak, honey and mint linger. 

What a fantastic rye.
Oil from an expressed orange peel and clove

This continues to be one of my favorites. I luckily found a bottle early on in trying out whiskey. Great early and consistent heat. Burnt caramel and vanilla early on. Finish with burnt marshmallow. Wonderfully smooth. Now I need to find another bottle
Definitely got the hint of smoke and is saltier, good spices.
Cinnamon and oak with a smooth finish. Great rye flavor.
Rich and spicy rye. Long finish that leaves hints of chocolate, mint and spice. Very good and well worth ~$50.
Complex, Caramel forward with strong spice notes and a sweet long finish.

Nose: butterscotch, caramel, barrel char, pickle, orange comes through after a few mins, as does the tobacco 
Palate: oily, honey, cinnamon, cream, tobacco, caramel, mint and chocolate show up half way through the pour
Finish: long and hot, tobacco, pepper, oak

Nose is strong but after a few minutes the high alcohol fades away leaving orange, dark chocolate and banana bread. Tastes the same as the nose with baking spices. Finish is long with deep orange caramel coating your tongue for minutes.
Excellent balance between heat, spice and sweet. The dominating flavor profile for me is a mix of tobacco and figs, with a touch of mint in the background. Overall, my absolute favorite rye to date!
No problem here. Might be high rating, but I’m happy with it right meow

113.5 proof. Neat pour from fresh bottle. Stale popcorn and red hots, spicy.  Mint, cinnamon and a hint of menthol cherry on the finish. I was way more excited to find this bottle before I tried it, now it will go into Manhattans over the holidays. I have absolutely no idea how this bottle is expertly rated a 96

Powerful aroma consisting of cinnamon, french toast, orange, dill, leather, and musty old books. If that sounds like a strange combo, it sure is but it's also delightful. Amazingly low alcohol presence on the nose. I could sit here and sniff this all day. 

Palate: some chocolate not present in the nose, cinnamon toast crunch cereal, mandarin orange, and a hint of pickle.  The flavors are all very rich and bold. 111 proof lets you know it's there without becoming a distraction. 

Finish is very long and peppery (both chili and black) with additional notes of cherry and mint. Mouthfeel is thick and chewy which supports the rich flavors.

A truly great and unique whiskey; certainly never tasted anything like it and well worth the $57.  Sweet for a rye, but with crazy depth and complexity so it never gets cloying or boring in it's sweetness.  Instant re-buy.

Yet another whiskey that has achieved a cult status derived from a combination of quality and rarity. Let's see if the Willett leaves up to the hype.

Nose: Very bready, doughy, and spicy. Rye bread, dill, and cinnamon, leap out of the glass. High ABV is evident, not unpleasant. Beyond that is cherry, banana (almost like banana bread), toffee, and wintergreen green, rounding out a superb nose.

Palate: Still predominantly rye bread, dill, and cinnamon. Big dose of vanilla now. Something reminiscent of hay. Clove, nutmeg, and pepper compliment the cinnamon spice. Chewy caramel and a distinct banana bread note. Apple cider. Very slight cherry note. Just as spicy, but less fruity than the nose. Even more vegetal and earthy. Very nice.

Finish: The finish goes on damn near forever. Black cherry and white chocolate notes provide rich sweetness. Banana bread and walnut. More of the clove, nutmeg, cinnamon, pepper spice take over once the sweetness disappears. The experience concludes with a woody, oaky note. It's amazing that the finish offers just as much complexity as the palate; I find this an absolute rarity but it's true with this one.

5 stars. Best rye I've had. I say both without reservation. Phenomenal from start to finish. Especially the finish. At $60, it's a steal. Would love to try one of the other age-stated Willett ryes. It seems most of those were one-offs while this is their own only staple offering.

Cannot recommend this stuff enough. If you see it for anywhere near this price point, pull the trigger. I've already said too much. Enjoy!
Great rye. Equal balance of spice and fruit flavors. Must have for at home bars.
Lower spice than I like in a rye, this appears to be a lower rye profile but immensely pleasurable.
Spice bomb! Cinnamon overload. Love this!
Spicy and I like. Heat was ok, well rounded
Spice bomb! Makes me think of fall holidays

113.8 proof

The nose brings a fresh farm field and charcoal. This rye is SO smooth. The obvious rye comes through with some barrel. It doesn’t leave you overly dry like some ryes and the proof does not overpower the flavor all. The finish is medium in length and makes you want the next sip. Absolute must have and the best rye I’ve tried!
One of the best I've had.
Talk about flavor. This stuff tastes Soo good and Soo smooth. A+
Best Rye I've ever tasted. In one word, phenomenal. Worth every cent of the $$$ price if you are lucky enough to find a bottle.

Very very good rye. Cherry and spice on the nose. On the front is more cherry with cinnamon the burn then comes on and definitely has that rye burn but mellows out and leaves you with black cherry as it stays with you for a while.
Sweet burn with deep flavors of vanilla and cherry.
2019 112.2- For flavor and complex but has a tad bit of heat. A couple drops of water makes this perfect
2018 109.8 proof- Outstanding and incredibly smooth. Rye provides a full and complex flavors. No heat
Delicious, a well balanced, complex taste. Best with one big cube.
Very light smell maybe a little walnut. Buttery, very light rye spice, lemongrass on the taste. Very quick to leave your pallet, leaves behind a fresh citrus note.

Sweet, herbal, menthol nose. Fruity up front - grape, plum. Peppery rye followed by smokey, citrus, fruity finish. Subtle oak lingers once the alcohol evaporates. Surprisingly smooth for 111 proof. This might be my favorite rye whiskey to date...
Only had a taster at the distillery quite some time ago but remember it leaving a great impression. Need to find again!
So good! Glad to share with Matt and @Zslug

Spearmint, spiced peach, fig, honey, Tahitian vanilla, marmalade, oak. 

Just wow!

This one surprised me.  Cinnamon and sweetness on the nose compared to other ryes.  Has bourbon qualities.  Definitely red fruits in the palate and a good baking spice taste.  Not much pepper which can be a note I’m not found of in rye.  Finish is pretty long and drying.  Overall a very solid dram.  This is one I may always keep stocked at the home bar.  Well done
Floral and spicy aroma gives way to baking spices and oak notes. Medium finish leaves sweet cocoa and gingerbread flavors that linger.

Sweet and smooth with some spicy notes but not overbearing. Very complex nose that is quite good. High proof but does not taste that way. Very smooth. Harder to find in area price ranges from 65 - 80$

Still among my favorites. Still love the great heat. I still get vanilla, burnt marshmallow, caramel flavors as an after taste (see last tasting note). This time around, I can taste much more of the pickle brine up front. Subtle coffee flavor following is another thing I didn’t notice previously.
Really good rye, but it falls short at it's price point and availability.  HW Double Rye, OF Rye, KC Si Bar Select, are all very good and in good supply.

My 1st rye whiskey, so hard to rate higher with nothing to compare to.  This is the 113.2 proof bottling
N - immediately got smells that reminded me if powered tea, followed by pleasant wood notes
M - spicey citris
F - sweet smooth honey, with pleasant peppery explosion

Nose- cinnamon, barrel char, honey, caramel, cherries

Palate- cinnamon, orange, cloves, honey, caramel, vanilla, brown sugar, nutty, chocolate

Finish- long, oily finish with notes of cinnamon spice and a chocolate bomb at the end 

Fantastic. I really am blown away by this only being 4 years old. It’s bold and in your face, with heavy rye and baking spice. Chocolate rounds it out in addition to some nice fruit and sweet notes. This is good stuff and should be a staple in any whiskey collection... that is, if you can’t get your hands on a Willett Single Barrel.

Tried the 110 and 112 proof today. This review is for the 110, but I will be making some comparisons to the other. The 112 might have outside influence. Had Michters rye and OF 1920 right before. Knocking it down just a notch because cinnamon is not my think. 

This is amazing. Can’t believe it’s 4 years

N(4.5): cinnamon bomb just like the 112. Starts as big red chewing gum then evolves to a red berry cinnamon. Feels creamy and I get a hint of vanilla. A bit of floral and outdoor grassy notes which are light, interesting and delightful. Cupping my hands around the glass and nosing, I get plump juicy bright cherries with a dash of caramel on top. 
P(4.75): sweet red cinnamon. Reminiscent of the nose. Luscious mouth feel
F(4.75): nice creamy hug. Light oakiness that turns into oolong tea. Reminds me of milk tea boba. Same with the 112 earlier on today. Sooooo delicious. I’ve never gotten it from another whiskey. The tea is fresh and vibrant layered with creamy milky vanilla on top.
Hints of raisins and figs. Long finish, complex flavors.

My oh my oh my I'm tasting the fall 2019 batch bottled at 56.3 ABV. 112.6 proof. Nose is all candy sweetness, light caramel and dark dark fruit like sherry finished scotch or whiskey. Stewed fruit of raisin, ripe plums, dark cherry, blackberries and raspberries. Taste DOES NOT DISAPPOINT. All of the notes you get on the nose are on the palate too. The sweet berry notes, the juicy dark cherry, ripe juicy plums the raisins. The honey sweetness is very forward also. The mid palate becomes more of a traditional rye with the rye spice, a bit of an alcohol punch, mild wood notes (think eagle rare), and black pepper. Just before the finish you also get a fleeting touch of black licorice just before the finish. Finish is fairly long but not too dry but you get the wood notes and a slight apple skin bitterness along with apple flavor on the finish along with the return of the blackberries and even something I'll call herbal notes almost like you got a blackberry with some vine/stem attached. This reminds me very much of a sweet blackberry brandy the berry, the sweet and then the alcohol bite or a fortified merlot wine. I've bought 3 bottles can't get enough. If you're a sherry bomb scotch drinker or a sweet bourbon drinker looking for a sweet rye this is it.
A large ice cube helps this. Some heat initially on the lips, spice, and a little vanilla.  Nice long oaky finish.

Nose: grapefruit, chocolate, pumpernickel rye bread 

Palate: dark chocolate, fresh mint, rye, buttery/creamy caramel 

Finish: sweet creamy rye lingers on forever 

Overall: By far the best rye I've ever had. Most ryes I've had just taste like bourbon so having something where the rye stands out so much is really enjoyable. And at $51 this is a steal!

You've been hiding in the tall grass for the last half hour from the velociraptors. Now you're hungry. Lucky for you, there's a lemon and that tall grass is looking like it could be tasty.

Smells of lemon and pepper
Tastes like grass, and alot of it. Probably some dirt in there for good measure.

Make sure you chew quietly..

Nose: apricot, salted caramel, light fruitcake, light spice
Taste: some spice, more fruit
Finish: how the fuck is this four years? So nice
Fantastic sipper, I put a small ice cube in it but you don’t need it. It’s delicious with notes of a tootsie roll finishing into mango and nectarines.
Sweet, smooth nose belies the sharp dry spice once it hits your lips. Oaky finish with vanilla lingering.

향 : 보다 상큼, 허브, 높은도수
맛 : 달짝찌근, 뜨거운 호밀, 
피니쉬 : 스파이시&웜, 우디, 얼얼,

Recently landed one of these...not an easy whisky to get here. 

Nose - I get liquorice , cherry cough drops, and christmas spices. Water tames the spices and brings out a bit of a custards, but the spices don't stay faded long and come back in force. 

taste - See the nose really. I'm getting perhaps some kind of christmas dessert or you know perhaps even a ginger breadhouse. Yeah the vanilla icing and ginger cookie, I can totally see that here. There's still some cherry cough drops, a bit medicinal for sure, and rye spice. Water might bring out a bit more vanilla and sweet upfront but really not significant adjustments.

WOWED, not by whisky standards, but I must admit this was one I went in with low expectations on and I've been really impressed. I'm at a solid 3.0 here which might be among my highest rye scores, a spirit I like but rarely feel doesn't enough special to move into the higher scored ranges.I won't go back to this often, but it'll be a nice change of pace or perhaps a christmas dram.
Loved with couple drops of water

Very complex nose with clove, cinnamon, and vanilla. Plenty of barrel and rye spice on the palate that heats sweeter in the finish. Medium long finish. A good pour for its young age but well balanced.

This has to be one of, if not, my favorite rye(s) I’ve ever tasted. Incredibly complex and drinks way below the 110 proof on my batch. Amazing stuff here - rye spice, oak, baker’s chocolate... everything is done incredibly well. Buy this if you ever see it.
This is without a doubt my favorite American whiskey.
Sweet nose. Yellow raisin. Not too much spice. Sweet, smooth finish.

Nose: like opening a bag of fresh rye bread with a hint of cinnamon and char.  Really excites the palate.  

Palate: Tastes exactly like a rye should taste - now you are not only smelling that fresh loaf of bread, you are now consuming it straight from the oven.  Absolutely amazing.  Several spices seep in - nutmeg and vanilla being predominant.  Slight burn, but that’s to be expected with a 113+ proof.  Mouthfeel is exceptional - nice coating of tongue with huge flavors.

Finish: While every aspect of this whisky is amazing, the finish is the highlight of this pour. The “Kentucky Hug” seems to last forever and  the flavors linger and even grow stronger.  

Overall: Absolutely amazing.   I am a huge rye fan and this one has now set the bar high for all others.  If you can find it - buy it.   You will not be disappointed.
Rich and sweet with a looong finish with great spice
Very rich and smooth at the same time. Full-bodied with bourbon flavor!
I get the pickle and spice little chocolate

If theres something called 'tropical baking spices', this is it! Incredible nose of cinnamon, nutmeg, baking spices and tropical fruits, palate has a slight burn on it, but that doesn't outshine the richness of spices and a bit of a bourbon characteristic. Outstanding.

On the nose: tropical fruits and dill
The palate: dill with cinnamon, light brine, and rosemary.
So drinkable, I can always grab this.

Honey color. Nose has rye grass, spearmint leaves, cinnamon, allspice, nutmeg and hints of vanilla and brine. Full-bodied mouthfeel. Palate is a continuation of the nose with a lot of grassy rye and an explosion of baking spices, along with notes of orange zest and bittersweet chocolate, dill and oak. Finish is medium-long and minty, with less grassy rye and more rye bread, brine and lots of cinnamon and oak.

109.8 proof. Long finish, slight burn. Mint on nose and palate. Some oak comes out as you let it sit. Decent flavor but just missing for me, especially for the going price. Will have to try the 6 year.
So yummy! Wish I were sharing with @Zslug, @Kyle-Metes-Randolph, @OtisDB, @brandymcnamara and @jdjmad!
Sweet scent, hot flavor, spicy notes opened up after a rock melted
Full bodied, smokey and hot, very smooth and full of Carmel and vanilla.
Smooth. Rye spice. Just like a great rye
Favorite readily available rye at the moment. I’ve bunkered two of these - think they might be worth something in a few years.
Lots of cherry, very smooth finish

Nose: Vanilla and cinnamon and cream. Light floral character, maybe lavender.

Palette: More vanilla, grapefruit, hint of brine.

Finish: oaky and briny. Sweet cream.
So much character for a 4 year rye. Excellent rye spice, rich flavor, and a touch of that pickle element which I find both strange and appealing.
Lawd have mercy. This rye is the real deal. A good smoky middle sandwiched between sweet tea rye and a dry finish. Nicely executed.
Deep.  The definition of Rye for me.

I think high hopes ruined this for me. Luckily I only paid $23 for this bottle which is a steal. Unfortunately, one of the most disappointing things for me to notice in a whiskey is when it's too young or when the lack of age detracts from the overall experience. Which, 4 years for a rye isn't really all that young. Other than that it would be a decent sipper, but I think a 6+ year would be a show stopper.

Final Verdict, if you see it: get it and try it for yourself, you might fall in love. But if it's a dollar over retail, I'd hold off.

The Family Estate Rye which seems to be the current retail shelf boy. After I donated my $10,000,000 to the COVID relief, I cracked this sipper open and threw back a good 6 oz of it in commemoration of the good ol days on the set of the ol oprah show. lil spice, everything nice.

While not being overly complex in profile this rye is extremely well balanced with warm cinnamon notes. The fruit comes out with a hint of cherry on the nose and a good orange/citrus flavor on the back end. A pleasant hint of Oak from the barrel complements the the overall taste, taking the edge off the rye without losing its edge. From the first sip onward it consistently provides a well rounded and drinkably spicy rye. This straight rye is a staple in both of our liquor cabinets for the price, quality, and consistency in flavor it delivers every time.

Lots of cinnamon, caramel, spice in the nose. Palate comes with heat and lots of  classic bourbon flavors but with rye spice - it’s sweet, oaky, cinnamon, chocolate, caramel. Finish is long and full with apple pie, vanilla. Love this!

First opened
No water

Nose - vanilla, spice, cherry, apple, overall fairly sweet

Taste - floral spice, light oily mouthfeel, light vanilla, light caramel

Overall quite pleasant.
This was an exceptional rye and will be tough to beat.
Wonderful rye. Spicy approach eases off to a smooth finish
Was hoping for more but at this price point there’s better to be had. Not bad at all but doesn’t meet the hype
So smooth, clean and complex. Well done.

Willett rye is what it’s all about. Well rounded, packed with fun flavors.. Pretty much the ideal alcoholic beverage. A must have for rye fans and a must try for whiskey drinkers. Never sleep on this phenomenal bottle.

The short synopsis for Willett Rye:
Starts off prominently with bubble gum then sizzles into cinnamon. Joyous dram.
On the nose: caramel, candy, a hint of barrel char. The palate is spicy and rich with vanilla and a sweetness reminiscent of bourbon. The finish is clean with a bit of spice

I guess there are good ryes out there! The color is gorgeous and the taste is creamy caramel with smooth spices that go right up to the line of being too hot but then backs off for a nice smooth finish. And if you want more spices, as a few drops of water as it opens up the spices notes.

Nose: butterscotch, vanilla, cinnamon, apple cider vinegar, green apple, sweet nose with ample spice, slight lavender 

Palate: warm mouth feel, great spice, cloves, cinnamon, charred oak, medicinal cherry, molasses 

Finish: lingering warmth, sharp crisp oak, smooth spice, molasses

Nose is vanilla. Cherry and black liqurice. Very sweet on the nose. 

The palate is peppery up front. Strong vanilla with anise and dark cherry or plums. Some oaky char on the exhale with more vanilla and molasses.
